title: Under the sustainable sea(weeds): gimme Seaweed talks eco-friendly and organic snacks - FoodNavigator-USA.com
summary: gimme Seaweed's growth in the plant-based market highlights its sustainable practices, including partnerships with Korean farmers for organic, non-GMO seaweed production. The company emphasizes the environmental benefits of seaweed, such as its ability to absorb significant amounts of CO2. Additionally, they are improving convenience and accessibility with a new Grab & Go line, appealing to health-conscious consumers with nutrient-rich flavors. However, they also recognize the need to address consumer concerns about hidden ingredients in plant-based foods.
green_innovation: TRUE: gimme Seaweed's production of organic, non-GMO seaweed and its CO2 absorption greatly contribute to environmental sustainability and reduce negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of USDA organic, non-GMO certified seaweed represents a significant improvement in the product category, differentiating gimme Seaweed from previous offerings in the market.
green_product: TRUE: The seaweed produced and sold by gimme Seaweed is designed, manufactured, and consumed in a way that minimizes environmental impact, meeting the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The sustainable and organic farming methods utilized for seaweed farming minimize environmental impacts and promote the use of renewable resources, aligning with green process definitions.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311223 - Snack Food Manufacturing, 311940 - Seasoning and Dressing Manufacturing, 311119 - Other Food Manufacturing, 424490 - Other Grocery and Related Products Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not depict gimme Seaweed as engaging in greenwashing; rather, it details their genuine sustainable practices and adherence to organic standards.

title: Wheat replacement: South Korea partners with local food brands to intensify rice flour NPD - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: South Korea plans to utilize rice flour as a substitute for wheat flour to address food sovereignty and the supply-demand balance of rice. The Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs (MAFRA) collaborates with 15 major local food firms to develop 19 new rice-based products, promoting environmental sustainability through eco-friendly production methods. This initiative aims to combat the wheat supply shortage and enhance the local food industry by expanding the use of powdered rice in common food products. Ongoing research also focuses on low-carbohydrate and anti-aging rice flour ingredients to further boost powdered rice consumption.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the initiative promotes sustainability by utilizing an overproduced crop (rice) to create alternative products, reducing reliance on less sustainable wheat supplies and minimizing environmental impact during production.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article discusses the development of new rice-based products significantly different from previous offerings in the food industry, indicating a new business process that has been introduced to the market.
green_product: TRUE, since the rice-based products being developed aim to significantly reduce environmental impacts and promote sustainability throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, because the production methods for powdered rice involve eco-friendly techniques such as dry milling, which reduces water use and promotes large-scale, cost-effective manufacturing.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311511 - Fluid Milk Manufacturing, 311813 - Macaroni and Spaghetti Manufacturing, 311812 - Commercial Bakeries, 311919 - Other Snack Food Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article does not contain misleading or exaggerated claims about the environmental benefits of the products or processes; instead, it outlines a genuine initiative aimed at sustainability and addressing food security.
